intro: Phacelia eisenii, commonly known as Eisen's phacelia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Phacelia eisenii is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas.
